channel.title: [pi] cmd error whilst running the server..[pi]
channel.description:
quote: unhandled packet type: 14 size - 8.
just curious as to what it means, i'll ask about how to fix it later if I dont figure it out on my own :D

item.title: [pi] cmd error whilst running the server..[pi]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

its to much memory you need to delete some stuff and then run it its basically telling you that its using a lot of memory or too much. ask for help again with it :P, im probably not the one to help and check your compiler make sure its connected right. Cheers

Shut up.

@infal: it’s what it says. I don’t know what packet 14 is used for exactly without looking at a document, but let’s say for instance it is a shrimp (I know it’s not). You click on the shrimp and the client sends packet 14 to the server, and if it’s handled (set to do something) you will eat the shrimp, if it’s unhandled (not yet implemented), it’ll just send you the default case: ("Unhandled packet: " + packet + " " + packetSize + “.”);

Have a look through your ItemClick class or whatever it is, you should see the default case at the bottom of firstClickOption or whatever it’s called. It should contain an unhandled message.

Something like that, but nothing to do with being out of memory rofl ^.

A packet is just chunks of data, containing bits (information telling the client and server what to do - there’s some documentation on it somewhere by Graham, I’ll link you.

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] cmd error whilst running the server..[pi]
